newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Formulab says wins NASDAQ small cap listing.
newsitem.headline: Formulab says wins NASDAQ small cap listing.

text.p: Formulab Neuronetics Corp Ltd said on Tuesday it had successfully won approval to list on the NASDAQ Small Cap Market.
Formulab executive director Ken King said the company's American Depositary Receipts would be traded under the registration FNCLY from June 16.
Each ADR comprises 30 ordinary shares in the company.
King said the listing represented the first step in efforts to list on the NASDAQ National Market.
Formulab launched its neural PC, the Richter Paradigm Computer, in the United States in December 1996.
The computer was said to be able to process more complex problems than existing personal computers.
Formulab's share price tumbled shortly after the U.S. launch on media reports of a negative reaction to it.
The shares hit a peak around A$1.52 in December about the time of the U.S. launch.
Formulab shares closed two cents firmer at A$0.35 on Tuesday.
